name: Heroes & Generals
description: Shoot, blow sh!t up, fly or bark orders in the ultimate Free-to-Play, large scale, multiplayer, shooter experience. Thousands of players in multiple battles fighting one massive war of nations. The first to capture 15 cities takes the glory.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7, 8 or 10 Processor: 2GHz CPU w. SSE3 instruction set- dual-core Memory: 3 GB RAM Graphics: ATI HD 4810/NVIDIA 9600 GT or above (with >512mb RAM) DirectX: Version 11 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 2 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX compatible
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7, 8 or 10 Processor: Intel i5 processor or higher / AMD Phenom II X6 or higher Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 560 series or higher / AMD HD 6870 or higher DirectX: Version 11 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 3 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX compatible

reviews.review_text: I have paid for hundreds of games yet I have spent the most time playing this free to play game.

For New players  If You are looking to get into this game you need to be aware of few things  1 yes, it have pay to get stuff real life money shop, but you can get all of it with in-game money. Yeah, it will take time and so on, but after you get what u want it feels great, as well better stuff won't make you play better(i bought scope with gold and found out that i suck with it, while with iron sight i'm pretty good.) so only thing what recomend is veteran, it will give you some exp boost(it is if you like game)  2 You will die a lot, at least in begining, till you learn how to play, well i still die a lot, but i make some enemy players die a lot too :D what i meant is, head shoots, grenades, road kill - in time it may feel unfair, but you will learn how to stay alive long enough to take out 2 enemy tanks with panzer-snacker, kill rogue sniper and steal their stuff :D  3 i have heard that game have cheaters and ect. But as far i can tell, it have some skilled players too, and by investing time in it, not cash you can be one of them :)  4 grind, yeah, you can say it's grind fest, but which mmo isn't? And i will put it simple, if you like game, that grind won't matter for you, cose as you play you unlock stuff and as like i said, better stuff won't make you better(i'm rank 5 infantry, loving my starter G43, taking out higher rank players with their ‘’uber’’ guns, just need to play smart)  5 HaG, is not your standard FPS, you run straight to enemy- you die, you try to be next ‘’rembo’’ - you die, try to take out tank with standard grenades - die, so what you do is flank, take cover, prone, run in z style, use mother earth as your ally, report snipers to your team-mates, play as team, use suppres fire, smoke them out with grenades etc  6 you start out with 1 loadout, after a while you can customise to your playstyle, found what works for you  7 game isn't for all, especially not for 10-14 years old cry babies or short temper ppl and impatient persons. You need to take time with this one, take it slowly, set your goals and work hard to get them.   My first impression.  When i picked it up i didn't like it, i meant i died instantly in all possible ways, headshot, legshot, torso shot, roadkill, grenades…. And that money shop.. I with my friend was like, it's p2w, you can't do ♥♥♥♥ without paying rlm, enemy is op (playing as german and german only), and so on. But as we played we wanted to see how THE big war looks and we aimed to get on rank 5 and on the way till rank 5 some changes happen, not to game, to our playstyle … i stopped to run straight on enemy positions, stopped to stand up or still in 2v1 fights, stopped to aim for most kills, instead i start helping team in big picture. Capture objective points, kill rogue snipers, defend our points and so on… and the more i kept playing the more i enjoyed game, like now if i can get 1 good match out of 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ones it's worth it and the atmosphere of game are perfect, airplanes roaming sky, tanks rolling over land and me as infantry in middle of it all :)  + one can customise his character to his play style (be brave, be sneaky, be tanker, be pilot and so on) + rewarding unlock system what responds to your playstyle + great game to play with your friends (make a squad and you can team crush your opponent)  + think your enemy have better guns? Kill him and pick it up to see for yourself + game strongly rewards team play and tends to punish rambo wannabe’s  + nicely done progression system which will make you busy + good use of repair system which won't allow to spam op equipment( could be more balanced though)  + for f2p game are well balanced, u can get all what you need with ingame money, what leads to point where your opponent can't have something what You can't have (well it will take time, but then again more you play this game, more better you will become)  - vet. Bonus is overpriced, i need to spend 15£ to get it, so yeah, devs should make it down on 5£, cose i personally don't like to use gold, it's make me feel cheap  - only 2 tier system, so after you get rank 5 game kicks you out in big pot with high skilled players what makes it feel unfair sometimes, they could add tier 3 and and let tier 2 be mid ground for lvl 5-6 or 5-7 players to get around of things or something like that.. - game isn't friendly for new players, i mean if they don't get how to play it in first 10h they will leave it cause if you try to play it as regular shooter you will lick bottom forever… - no training grounds for tankers, pilots and ect … i mean, i would love to see what is what before i spend shitloud of my hard earned in game cash to switch my infantrymen on different branches, so that should be fixed.. - upper point and some other design choices tend to lightly hint on more cash in, then delivering most to players enjoyment and it's sad.  For dev ….  I got it, that one needs earn money to keep supporting game and making it better, but if one truly says that they have players first before cash in you should fix some things, first make it separate vet. buying option, so one can spend ~5£ to get vet. Not 15£ to get vet and leftover gold.(one day saw over 10k players on steam, if half have a vet it's already reasonable cash on month) In my opinion it would be nice sub model for beta game and still would make money. As Well player should be able to see all clases himself in advanced training so they know what they are getting because now it's buying cat in bag…  P.S.   Great game, eager to see it expand and become better:) 8/10

Many people call H&G a grindfest; and that's really hard to answer, H&G has no end tier equipment, so it's a constant grind, you can recruit more and more soldiers to get your dream loadout, there's no end, there's no 'best weapon', there's no 'best career', there's no 'best tank', there's no 'best camouflage'. You choose what you'd like to own, you can't have it all, unless YOU deside to own another soldier, another weapon, another tank... although owning one is more than enough.  People also confuse H&G to be P2W; Heroes and Generals is NOT P2W, it's Pay-25-Bucks-To-Skip-5-Hours-Of-Grind and there's not a single item exclusive to 'P2W' players (Unlike WoT and WT), which debunks the 'This is P2W/has Paywalls' arguement (unless you really think that paying 25 bucks to skip 5 hours is a serius advantage).  As for the gameplay, it's Fun & Addicting. Which is exactly why paying in H&G is more of a way to support Reto than skip a few hours of playing.  However, I do admit the optimazition on this game is ♥♥♥♥

First off this game is different then any other game I own--or have ever owned. I have about 100 games installed on my comp right now and have spent good money on well over a 1000 games since pong caught my attention--closer to 1500.   If it looks cool, if its different, if its well liked, if it looks better then other games, I buy it.   Sad to say, most the games I have bought, I have played less then an hour. Looking at my steam collection is a good sign of that. When a game clicks with me, I play countless hours. Star control, Panzer General, the first Res Evil and so on. I'm guessing there are a lot of players like that--playing only a few games even though have many to choose from.   Ok why did H&G suck me in? Almost 1600 hours. Pretty sure that is a record for me.   Well to tell a painful truth, I not that good at shooters. Because of that I have played very few --for more then an hour at least. I bought a few hundred but I was frustrated with them because I suck.   I played the first WW11 online from the day it came out and for many more months after. 45 minutes to get into a battle, running or riding on a tank to get there. 1 to 5 minutes later dying once you found one. Why would someone do that for months on end? Because those 1 to 5 minutes where unmatched and unrepeated by any other game. I did that all day long and lost all interest in all the other games I owned at the time--had over 600 at this point.   Years later, along comes H&G  I was beyond excited to download it on Steam and dig right in. I started well over a year ago and back then, it had a very different shell but was the same game you play today at its core. Lots of toys have been added, looks a lot better, but feels the same and plays the same--I'm so happy they stayed true to that.   A mid-level player can own with knowledge and practice...that is not very common in an on line game. You don't have to be a super good player to top charts. You just need to play smart and learn as you go. Point A to B at a certain spot on the map is great for getting kills and so on. Moving every time you kill someone in that area and knowing which way they will try to flank when they come for revenge. Very few games let you make up the difference of poor shooting with well thought out strategies. It's awesome.   If you get past the part when you have no idea what's going on and what's going to happen next, you will see a huge difference in the game. If you're already a super good FPS player you will do well right off and do even better later. The leaning curve is tiny and hung at the same time--very hard to explain. The first weapon is super deadly in a person a knows the game well, and very hard to get kills in a noobs hands--even one that rocks at FPS's normally.   That is why it's nothing like other games. The balance is spot on. The weapons are hard to use until they are familiar, just like real life.   This is my favorite game of all the games I have played since pong. I'm picky. I'm ♥♥♥♥♥y. I don't just go with the flow if I'm not happy. I have been sucked into only a few games over the years but none have kept me going like this one. It's simple. It's difficult. It's awesome.  Lisa Eve  10/10 +

This is a brilliantly well balanced Free to play game. I've played from the beginning which means I have several rank 15 characters, and can say that all it takes in order to be good and always have the funds to buy something new (Even cosmetic things yes) is dedication! My friends and I can easily get a character from rank 1-7 in a day no matter the area of expertise. Once the player is at that rank with the proper early game budgetting and has learned their way around the game. They can easily support any playstyle they wish the more than enough funds to even try out new things.   The people whom I normally see complain are the ones that actually put money into this game.. I have not spent a dollar and nor do I plan too Its not necessary and in my opinion ruins things like goals 'Im gonna get to that STG-44 some day I just know it'   Also to all those who think its hard to get going cause 'My starter gun sucks' Learn how to upgrade it for your playstyle. I only use the Gewehr on my Rank 12 Paratrooper and it has an accurate rank of 50m but can kill in 1-2 shots.   Basically Heroes and Generals is a great game for you and some friends to get involved in. Remember its War. Itll suck sometimes and be awesome some other times but all it takes is you to be awesome.

One thing i want to make very clear is P2W (Pay To Win) AND Pay To Skip are two very different things. Unlike world of tanks or some other free games out there there are no vehicles or weapons that only paying customers can use. A free game cannot simply live, even if it the best one made ever, withought having something to buy and some incentive too. BUT EVERYTHING CAN BE GOTTEN FREE. Is there a grind? Yes. But it is as it must be in any free game. It is an enjoyable enough experience that i wont spend a dime and ill work hard for that shiny carbine and satisfaction, but not so much a grind its unbearable. Is this game for everyone? No. But dear god jesus above stop calling it P2W, becasue it is not. You can't buy a win.

SPEAKING PURELY FROM SOMEONE WITH A PASSING INTEREST THAT ONLY PLAYED SOVIET INFANTRY  Is H&G a   balanced   game? No, I would be lying if I told you that certain U.S. and Germany weapons take as much skill to play as frankly most of the Soviet Weapons.  Is H&G a   fun   game? In my opinion, this is a very fun game. There are definite goals to work towards, usually guns or badges, and when you get there you feel accomplished because they really do change the game. The level to get in War Battles aka 1337 $KI11S has been getting higher due to recent updates which is good news for the people that actually pay for each deployment in War. IMO, the realtime strategy is for nerds who like doing nerd things like playing the realtime strategy. Without people deploying squads in war though, there would be no war battles, so do what floats your boat as both the strategic game and the action game are neccesary for success.  A tip for players starting out,   dont go into war battles trying to grind.   Staged battles are for farming kills and getting xp for that new badge or gun, but everytime you deploy in war to not do the objectives, or worse still, try to suicide run the objective, a general has to pay out of his pocket for your ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥y. After you have a character you like and are comfortable playing, then I suggest you go to war. Your mark of maturity will come after you see three krauts go flying in your triple nade kill. Also wear headphones or earbuds because hearing and subsequently running away from the sound of grenade is a skill you will have to learn quickly.                                                   please join su everyone is memeing on the koreabine and mlg3420

Its good fun.  If you dont run around out of cover, and know how to work in a squad, you'll have a good time playing this. People who get irritated with multiple spawning, because you ARE going to die, shouldnt try this.  The entry level weapon is perfectly fine even unmodded if you use it in one of two ways. Careful aiming while in cover, or hip fire and move like a mexican jumping bean. Altough dont jump, coz you cant shoot while you do that!  Later in game you can play as a paratrooper, tank commander, pilot or specialised sniper recon. All fun in their own ways, all with pro's and cons.  The 3 factions USSR, German and US are mostly balanced, but you'll find it boils down to play style more than anything else.  Give it a go! Its free and fun and if you can find 2 friends to play with, REALLY good fun! ;)))

He says, 'A Mercedes and a huge diamond ring.' The poor man says, 'Why'd you get her both?' The Rich man says, 'If she doesn't like the ring, she can take it back to store in her new car, come home and still be happy.' The Poor man says, 'O.K. That works.'  The Rich man says, 'Well what did you get your wife?' The Poor man says, 'A pair of slippers and a ♥♥♥♥♥.'  The Rich man says, 'Why'd you get her a pair of slippers and a ♥♥♥♥♥?' OK First of all let me get something out of the way. 90% of the reviews I've seen of this game are outdated since, in the last year, 2 GAME CHANGING updates have been released so double-check the reviews you're reading are from the past 3 months.  This game is ♥♥♥♥. You die a lot. Teams barely coordinate. People are trolls. THIS IS NOT A GAME FOR PEOPLE NEW TO PVP-FPS GAMES!!!!  That said, the game offers a unique experience (and since people are XP hungry in all games and totally lack coordination it's not that strange).  While this game is, indeed a major grind if you're not the PAY2WIN shitehole, that just means there's plenty of time to pick up weapons before buying them and there's more significance in attaining a powerful weapon (hard work pays off).  Also it is because this game is ♥♥♥♥ that it's hilarious (real war isn't). I mean seeing a (intact) corpse flying up 40 feet and hitting a plane when you drive over an anti-tank mine is comedy gold!  This game is NOT an accurate WWII simulation game because there are spawnpoints, YOU AS A SOLDIER PAY FOR YOUR STANDARD-ISSUE WEAPONS, Privates (low rank) can end up as the squad leader in charge of Captains (high rank), and the performance of different vehicles, weapons, etc... are heavily influenced by complaints from the community   (example: the Jumbo heavy tank that is only competative because its frontal armor was realistically too thick to be penetrated, but people commanding the most over-powered tanks in the game complained and the DEVS nerfed it out of being competative).  NOW FOR THE PROS!!!!  The game is still (despite no longer being BETA) improving! Major updates fixing/adding certain features are coming out (assists are actually less than a month old in the game while beta left 2-3 months ago)  You can play as a 'General' once you get to a certain point in the game. The Generals side is a REAL-TIME-STRATEGY component of the game. To describe this side, imagine the game Civilization or Sins of a Solar Empire : You command Units known as Assault Teams and send them to cities where players spawn using those resources to fight their 'Heroes' side.  The maps are so detailed (and in-depth) that players who have 2000+ hours on tha game (played for 2+years) still find new features daily (NOTE: one of recent game-changing updates remodeled all maps to help spawn-camping issue so that reference is pre-Garmon update)  There is a large Twitch Streaming community that provides the only real TEAM-WIDE coordination in battles.  There is now a way to report abuse in-game  There is a universal way to quickly ask for a ride - 'F' - whistle - when whistling outdoors most vehicles stop to let you hop on. Indoors it's used to relay info such as 'Point Clear' or 'The area by me is clear'  Lastly any and all headshots, even by the weakest weapon in the game, is instant death.     IMPORTANT NOTES FOR THE NEW PLAYERS!!!  any explosives will cause repair costs to skyrocket.   First weapon you try to buy should be the T1 SMG for your faction  anti-tank weapons are especially expensive per use  first new soldier you buy should be a Tank crewman - Killing tanks with a tank is the most practical way to get credits for average skilled players  DO NOT BUY A PILOT!! The price per spawn is more than anything else in the game (500 each)!! Also the flight controls are abnormal so first time flying you'll be lucky with just 10 suicides via collision (5k creds lost)  Be mindful of upgrades to weapons (like high-damage high-precision rifle rounds) to increase Rate of Fire and Damage   Be sure that when the rest of your team pushes to the next point, you stay behind to defend. It's not uncommon to have 12 people (2/3 team) capturing the next point and have your push stopped by 'Ghost cappers' that capture the previous point while your team is traveling/capturing the next point.

This game is quite difficult to review, or get an overall picture of how it is. Since the majority of people enjoy something 'EZ' because nobody got any patience for anything these days. The game is a grind, and there is no denying that. It'll take a long time to unlock a gun, and even longer to unlock it's attachments to make it suit your taste. It can be difficult to learn, as there aren't really much explaining how the squad system works, so you'll have to Google it. Unless I missed something.   But it's a great game. There is microtransactions, but it's not as bad as one might think. You can buy gold to purchase guns, attachments or vehicles. After buying whatever your heart desired, you'd still have to unlock the attachments which would be even more gold. So it'll easily be quite a lot of money than it's even worth, as players who chose the easy way still doessn't have any knownledge how the gun performs. So it's not as bad as it is in some games. You can also chose to just grind out everything, I've only obtained 18.5 hours at the time writing this and I've unlocked an SMG, sniper and a Jeep. So it's not impossible to unlock a lot of stuff if you're decent at the time.  But overall it's a pretty great game, as microtransactions doesn't really seem to be an issue, atleast not in my eyes. Everything is easily unlockable if you just grind for it a bit.

(Edited as I wanted to put the review in more depth) Okay, so I've played Heroes and Generals for some time now. I really like the concept of the game, though it has its flaws.  Things it did right:  - The game. The game itself is a wonderful concept that has been made to the liking of many players.  - The guns. You can play as you want. You can buy a semi-auto or an auto rifle depending on your playstyle and upgrade it to your liking  - The modes. There are three main modes of play in Heroes and Generals: Assault, War and Skirmish. Each has its own difficulties and tactics.  Things it did wrong:  - Anti-cheat. This flaw is blatantly obvious, and can be noticed withing 10 or so games. There are a few main types of cheating in this: Wall hacking (Where the player can see other players through the walls), Aimbotting (The cursor tracks players), and XP / credit farming (where one player lets another get a LOT of kills on them, to farm XP and credits).  - Currency. This is well thought out in most places, but when the cost to repair your sniper rifle is more (Per shot) than you gain from a kill, it becomes an issue and you just end up waisting money.  - The players. Most team-mates dont actually care about winning the game or the objective. To them it is more of a CS:GO type of game than it is a strategy, which is what this game tries so hard to be, most players will either be absolutley terrible (Which I can understand, but the matchmaking levels (Bronze, Silver, Gold) should be sorted out) or they will be trolls and team kill or greif.  - Grenades... Oh boy, this one pisses me off. Grenades are not only the most over-powered pieces of ♥♥♥♥ in the game, but you can carry 3 per item slot (Meaning that a normal player can carry a max of 9 with no gun). Players seem to find it enjoyable that you can just throw these ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s one after another until you kill the player you are trying to kill. I find this extremely stupid, as not only do these cost more to use than you get per kill, but RETO enforces the idea of using them.   RETO complains about losing money, but they only really have themselves to blame. You need to listen to your players. Think about adding / changing:  - The amount of carriable grenades  - The cost of repairs on certain weapons (As the recon class is now useless)  - An actually somewhat useful anti-cheat system  Aside from that little rant... love the game... would recommend..

Let's just get this straight: Over half of the negative reviews complain about issues that are already fixed, stuff you would expect in a F2P game(like hackers), or just personal issues with the game, which is okay, but try to criticize their reviews a bit. Anyways, there is nothing to lose playing a F2P title.  Here are some positive sides of the game: -F2P, so it is free to try, and you won't lose anything if you are patient enough to not spend money -A large variety of classes, weapons, and vehicles to use -pretty good graphics for a F2P title -Grind is not too bad, just learn to enjoy rather than just get XP, but that is hard for credits -All classes hava a role, like planes kill tanks, and tanks kill infantry, while infantry is still fun to play -New content is released pretty often  And also some negative sides: -Some weapons are deffinitely better than others, like the STG44, which is absolutely brutal at most ranges -Though they are fun, the physics are very bad -Credit gain is too low, and you have to spend a bunch on repairing, seriously limiting the amount of weapons you can use to grind credits -Loading times are horrible -Unbalanced tank gameplay in many cases, the chaffee doesn't have any weaknesses if the matchmaker is on it's side -Matchmaker is pretty bad, always listing good players against bad players -I have not noticed any anti-cheat, other than the 10-report ban -Although they are large, there are too few maps -The new content is not always useful, and often just breaks the game more, adding grind to certain weapons and making grinding credits hard because your own weapon has to be pretty unupgraded  If you just learn to enjoy grindy games, you can definitely have fun in this one. Keeping the thought of XP and credits in your mind all the time just makes you bored. If you want a fast-paced shooter, this is not the game for you.

Ok...  heroes and generals IS a pay to win game, but only for the veteran membership. this membership allows you 2 badge slots, and also a 4th inventory slot. (but noone cares about that) the badge slots allow you to to gain some perks, like faster reloading, and damage resistance. if you do not buy veteran (which only lasts for a maximum of 90 days)*fact checkers welcome*)) you will only get one badge slot, which makes you choose between a faster reload speed or damage resistance, longer sprint duration, etc... and one would argue that you could get the veteran membership using in-game credits, but buying a membership for a short period of time with your hard-earned credits is the dumbest thing you could do with them. i guarentee that you would rather buy something like a lazer gun (mg42) for your nazi, rather than a couple days of an OP loadout, and increased experience/credits.  to summerize the rest of my arguement, this game has me absolutely addicted! i love mowing down countless commies, yankees, or whatever faction you choose to play. the updates are definately not killing this game, the elaphant in the corner of the room (reto.) thinks that having these exclusive 'veteran' features in the game help improve the quality of the game by allowing the dev team to have a salary for their work. And i can completely understand their logic! i would absolutely love to contribute money to this games development, but not if it means that i would have a competative edge over other players. and that is the reason why i have never once purchased gold for anything. i would much rather pay something like $20 for this game if it meant that this p2w system was abolished.   as this game stands, i give it a solid 6/10, primarily due to the pay to win setup, otherwise it would be a 10/10.

I’ve decide to review this game after the last update took place (Garman), because it really improved the game in my opinion. Got about 30+ hours after Garman. I will show you some pros and cons.  Pros:    Free-to-play: of course you grind faster when you pay, but why should you do it if it isn’t necessary. You chose, your time or your money.    Big arsenal of weapons, vehicles, tank, … .    Verity of factions: US, SU, Germany.    Different types of soldiers at each faction: Infantry, recon, tanker, pilot, para’s.    Spawn protection. God thanks!    New maps with bigger capture point. Gotta cap them all!    Amphibious vehicles.    The forum, beside the trollers and some guys complaining about (almost) everything, you have the nice guys who will be pleased to help you out with your problems.    Anti-cheat, report system, …    Nice strategy side of the game (generals side).    Nice graphics    Decent frames per second (could by my computer)    Sounds: guns, walking, breathing, driving, and funny horns.    And many more …   Neutral:    Balance, some say it isn’t balanced, some say it is. Ones you start to play each faction, you will notice that the game is balanced, but that some factions have OP weapons, but hell yeah every faction have some. so it’s not a big deal.    Example: Germans and SU will complain about M1/M2 carbine, will US and SU hates MG42, meanwhile PTRD isn’t loved by Germans and US.    Price of weapons, vehicles, … some things doesn’t seem logic like a handgun that is more expensive than a tank. but comparing a tanker to a infantry just isn’t making any sense. Would you like it if your starter tanker needs to pay +150.000 credits to buy the second tank, hell no!    Aux-seats, lot’s off people don’t use them or just don’t have one due to squad leader and squad member ribbon.    Servers are often down (after updates): they’re down for a reason, to improve! So just wait and see what new goodies they will bring.    Cons:    Price of camo’s they’re pretty expensive, but it’s just a luxury item so no big deal, I would recommend you to safe your gold to but some fancy camo’s.    You could have a long matchmaking queue, when you start to play the game from zero. Ones you go to a higher matchmaking group, this will be solved (bronze, silver, gold). This is more a starter problem.    Squad 2.0: just joking, after all this hours I played with it I couldn’t say anything bad about it.   I probably forgot somethings, but they aren’t that important.  Conclusion: So If you want to play a free-to-play WW2 FPS, I would recommend you to give this one at try. It might be hard in the beginning, but after some hours, you should improve quickly. If you want to improve more quickly, You should find a friend to play with.  Last but not least, sorry for bad English you grammar nerds.   bski   TLDR: nice FPS, just play and have fun.

Heroes and Generals is a World War 2 shooter similar to Battlefield. I have watched people complain about 'Pay 2 Win' my entire playtime, and need to clear a few things up. H&G is NOT Pay 2 Win. i have over 120 hours and have never spent a single penny, at first you will struggle, this is a difficult game. However, i have saw people dominating 60+ with the starter rifle. All weapons have the potential, dont blindly buy the more powerfull upgrades, each upgrade comes with a sacrafice, Higher fire rate = Less accuracy, More damage = greater recoil. Once you reach Rank 5 you will be brought out of the N00b Pool. you will then face against tanks, planes and specialist forces. i suggest getting the American, German and Soviet soldier to level 4, that way you have a rough idea what you are going against before hitting rank 5. the grind, gets easier, your main source of income is your soldier salary, as you rank up this increases. 1 hour of game time give you however much, right now im getting around 20k per hour. upgrades are getting easier to afford. The game is most cetainly not pay to win, the amount of people stating this are the guys who just suck in general. if you want some tips, Kotton Gamer on YT is a good watch, he plays H&G. But dont let the noobs put you off. this is an Epic game, with frequent updates adding new Maps, gear, Bug fixes. the Devs are fairly dedicated. 9/10

I have to say im really sad to see this game not having very positive views. for a free to play game, this is without a doubt my favorite. I would honestly pay money for it. Not a full 60$ but if it was like 20-15$ it would still be worth it for sure.   The actual FPS part of the game really is alot of fun, different movment style and physics feel different, but really good. The vast amount of guns, vehicles, attatchments, and character classes add an element that i dont feel like any other WW2 shooter has. Good clean gameplay, very impressed. Again, especially for a free to play game.  Now, the one thing i was very confused about was the menu and how the game works, how to get in the game, how to choose characters etc... the menu/loudout screen was very hard to figure out at first. I would higjhly reccommend looking at some community guides before playing. However, once i got the hang of it, it is an easy to use system and i dont really have any complaints about it.   Since it is free to play, my biggest concern about the game was 'is it play to win?'. I can honestly answer, not at all. The game has gold, which you can buy for real money and use that to buy weapons and gear, but you dont have to. It is only a shortcut. You earn an in game curreny called credits and you can use that to buy weapons and gear, etc. Earn it buy playing matches and doing your best. It takes a while to accumilate but nothing a little but of grinding cant fix.  All and all i really really enjoy this game. Feels like a mix of CoD 3 multiplayer, battlefield 2, and a hint of red orchestra. My only critic would be to maybe add more maps and gamemodes in the future to keep gameplay intresting. Very well done! My hat is off to you devs. 4 out of 5 stars.

If you don't like CTDs every ~40 minutes, a complete lack of useful communication from teammates, getting teamkilled by bicycles, fighting enemies that will throw every grenade they have at the drop of a hat, being PTRD-41 zerg'd by the Soviets, having inept edgelords lose every single War battle for Germany, being forced to use matchmaking that can queue you for anywhere between 10 seconds to 10 minutes on average, being placed into games with 150+ ping, or grinding your unmentionables off to get anything... I maybe would stay away. It is good, free fun though, when you get passed all the poor design decisions.  If you have friends that are decent in pretty much any shooter, have a VOIP server you can use (no VOIP in game, and there's a char limit for textchat), it's pretty alright. The grind isn't as bad as it used to be, Credit farming can be a pain, but playing the objectives and taking out enemy assets will get you there faster. The inability to edit your loadout midmatch is still something that irritates me, but if your fireteam accounts for most possibilities, it isn't the end of the world if you don't have your own AT weapons or are stuck with an SMG.  'Repairing' your grenades is still one the dumbest things I have ever seen. 6-7/10.

I somewhat enjoyed this game, a little, simply because it fulfills a kind of niche no other game has filled for me in quite some time, that's probably the only reason I kept playing as long as I did. however this game is also extremely frustrating as it is full of glaring balance issues and has a run away monetization system that absolutely ruins the entire game and any fun you might have had as soon as you reach the 'gold' tier of matchmaking.  Once you get into Gold Tier matchmaking all enjoyment your first ten hours gave you is going to leave instantly unless you are an extremely patient person or really enjoy this type of gameplay, you will from then on be matchmade with people with weapons twice as powerful as your own. People in tanks and planes which you have no good counter to and snipers that can one hit you with a bodyshot which is ridiculous, the rifles should do 99 damage maximum with a headshot needing to score you the one hit kill. This game isn't CoD and a rifle shouldn't one hit kill someone to the torso up to the distances that they do in this game but this is only one of the many glaring balance issues facing new players.  The base weapons when you buy them  should not  be half as powerful as the same weapons but with upgrades leaving you at a distinct disadvantage to those who have spent more time in the game than you, or someone who has thrown money at the game. The fact a game with this much potential is being held back by what seems to be blatant greediness by the developer is a real shame. You can really feel a good game under all this somewhere but this game's monetization model absolutely and completely ruins it. If you've ever played Planetside 2 you know what to expect from this game, fork over the cash or be at a disadvantage forever. Actually the thing Planetside 2 has going over this is in Planetside 2 you don't have to pay free credits to repair your weapons, a system that absolutely goes to show just how greedy the devs are.  I'm going to give an example of what you can expect as a free player with no intention to pay money, or if you are someone without access to a means to pay for things.  I saved up to get the Mosin Nagant because I wanted to be a bolt action infantryman as semi-autos are really not to my taste, I buy it only to find it does around 50 damage a shot, thus far it has taken me about 5 hours of gameplay with a lot of matches where I have done insanely well and I still have not unlocked any of the upgrades which increase it's damage meaning I have been stuck playing at a serious disadvantage and at the rate I get the free currency even when I do unlock the upgrade, I will not be able to afford them for quite some time.  I am left using a bolt action rifle with iron sights, that does 50 damage a shot while the majority of others in the game have rifles that kill in one shot to the torso or have semi-automatic rifles that do 75 damage a shot or sub machine guns that mow you down without you having even a remote chance at fighting back.  Oh and the pistols cost a stupidly high amount of the credits so don't think you'll be having a backup sidearm any time soon.  Do not play this game unless you enjoy grinding or are willing to fork over some cash to get onto the level of everyone else.

(I HAVE RESUMED PLAYING THE STEAM VERSION)  This game has the potential to be something great, it really does. Unfortunately that potential is wasted.  The balance in this game is ♥♥♥♥ poor, mostly early on when you are just starting off. For tanks it is painful, especially for Germany as you can be fighting light tanks from 1944 while driving a tankette from 1934, a full decade behind. Tanks with machineguns should only be fighting tanks with machineguns, otherwise they are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ useless. Even later tanks are pretty badly up tiered, with an M3 Lee, a tank from 1941 that only lasted until 1942 because it was obsolete the moment it was put into service, is fighting Panthers, T-34-85s and other tanks from 1944. Low tier tanks mostly involves being seal clubbed, that's all it is until you get lucky and fight stuff on your level or get a better tank.   The grind is hilariously bad, you need to put in twice the time to get ANYWHERE in terms of progression with equipment, and most of that as stated before is just getting seal clubbed a whole lot. Credit income is VERY low and you have to pay for ammo and repairs for vehicles and weapons alike so that just makes it worse along with the RIDICULOUS prices of stuff you need to buy. You pretty much HAVE to buy veteran membership to progress without grinding for days on end, and that costs a lot of money. From what I have been hearing some people have been getting banned for 'cheating', when it's just a broken ♥♥♥ anti-cheat system or a scam so people will make a new account and spend money on it to progress.  Short version, this game is terribly imbalanced and the devs need to get their ♥♥♥♥ together and fix it becuase it's not getting any better. Go ahead and try it, first few hours in you will realise how painful the grind is from the bottom. I'm not saying not to try this game, do try it, it has great potential and can be quite enjoyable at times, it just becomes painful to play rather quickly if you dont advance or get uptiered.

Conceptually:  Amazing war simulator with a fairly good strategy element to it as well as a decent focus on team play to take objectives. Classes of soilder are pretty awesome and fairly well balanced when everything comes together properly, couple snipers, some tankers, plenty of infantry, a few paratroopers, and a general heading the team. The period accurate weapons function exactly how you'd hope, innaccuarcy and all which can add to the feel of the game. The potentional for full war campaigns between the different nations present offers limitless battle possibilties.  Reality:  Teams generally end up unbalanced with your tanker being level one and having a crappy tank that gets one shot by the enemies max rank god tier vehicle which can also make things worse when just starting out in any class other than infantry. You end up just constantly losing over and over again to people who you really have no chance of beating no matter how good you are and then you level up at a snails pace but even after you get there you'll never earn enough credits to actually buy the stuff you need (credit costs for anything are insane and then they even threw in repairs). Yes your vehicles should be stronger the higher up you go, no you shouldn't be matching veterans with basically brand new players, especially when your equipment actually makes a noticable difference in your ability to play and when the servers are so unbelievably overloaded that there are 4k man queue times just to log in this kind of tier mixing shouldn't be happening.  While I'm talking about the servers being overloaded, I should also mention they're complete crap...sometimes. As in every match you get into its a complete roll of the dice as to if your 5 ping actually means anything. With a constant 120 fps and an average of 10 ping I can barely move half the time because I'm getting ruberbanned left and right and even if I play sniper and just crouch down somewhere my targets are just warping everywhere so I still can't do anything. There have been multiple requests by the playerbase to prevent matching us into games where this is going to happen which would also level out the teams and possibly boost the community and overall player experience but these pleas seem to fall entirely on deaf ears.  Overall: No, I can't recommend it because I simply can't see anyone really enjoying this game with its numerous problems. I know you see the good reviews scattered around but those people are, quite honestly, just lucky. They don't get placed in the games where suddenly nothing you do matters and everything is just going to warp around regardless of your connection. They don't get the games where your entire team is gimped with starter level players against a team of seasoned veterans. For most of us, at least half the time, we get into a horrible game with no chance of winning and barely an ability to move around just to try and at least enjoy our loss.

Tried this game again and brooded over the mechanical issues besides the horrible execution of the pay system. (Seven American dollars for a semi-auto sniper or a month of grinding on a normal healthy one hour of play a day give or take)  The ironsights are at least four feet from your soldier's face, making the only reason to actually pull to aim the accuracy bonus you get in the RNG rather than any player aim. Additionally you'll get frustrating cases of running across half the battlefield to get to the fight. If you die after fourty seconds of fighting, you spend the next two minutes walking back to where to fight. And if you factor in that sometimes the other team will have a sniper on a hill half a KLK away outside of the five foot high detail draw distance regardless of rig. You spend more than that time away from having any fun.  They also can't balance armor. SU-76 came out and has been already sold off as a cheaper, weaker version of other tank destroyers. Even though the gun on it should be scaled the same as the T-34 with more accuracy they failed to do so.  Recon is irrelevent because in map games no recon divisions exist from the generals. Completely useless branch unless you exclusively play on normal matchmaking.  They also appear to have a lackluster matchmaking system, frequently having a match with strong seasoned players bouncing on top of the heads of unskilled players. A small portion of the fault going to the playerbase itself since the good players seem to gravitate to the German faction for one reason or another (False sense of superiority I suppose)  The map wars are usually pretty uneventful. Not even worth paying attention to them really, it's the same story with slightly different preformances. Wehrmacht player stack Italy with thousands of thousands of troops on the chockpoints and Abandon Berlin to the race between Russia and the Allies. Then night hours roll around and the Russian faction who is populated by mostly Russian players come online, pressure, then either they win in that time or they log off and the North American players log on, butt heads, kill Russia, and the US or Germany wins. Usually depends on who killed Russia.   TL:DR, it's all honestly just a blob of outdated ideas and more of a game about walking from point A to point B without getting shot with false depth and false ironsights that don't exist.

This is a game i'd like to give a 'neutral' review, as there is definitely the foundations of a great game here, but the combination of the truly biblical grind for any fun gear and the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ GOLD TIER MATCHMAKING the game throws you in if you have more than ~10 hours meant i've mostly given up for now. Suddenly facing T-34's, fighter planes and terrifyingly skilled paratropers with ppsh-41's makes me feel like an AI in someone elses shooter.  A gentler entry system for new players where we could be introduced to armor and aerial elements would be nice, as would a more cohesive organisiation system so I actually know what to do rather than being left to fend for myself versus the pro platoon.  A possible solution here would be to remove the F2P element and charge £20-25 up front, but at the moment the game is crippled by the grind meaning that I can't motivate myself to work for any good stuff, when that might be tens if not hundreds of hours away.  Seems like the core of a really solid world war 2 shooter is already here, but at the moment there really is more bad than good . My recommendation for the time being would be to play until level 8 and then stop, because until that point the game is great fun, followed by dive bombers and despair.

Are you tired of getting killed by those pesky enemy snipers? Here's what you gotta do. Take your bicycle and ride it downhill, look for an enemy sniper and run into him at full speed, and have a laugh as his corpse flies through the air.  Now, for the serious & detailed part of the review  Pros (What I liked in Heroes & Generals) + Free to play (duh) + Good camouflage mechanics + Infantry, tanks and aircraft fight together + Combination of a first-person shooter and strategy game  Cons (What I disliked in Heroes & Generals) - Long queue times - Matches that end a second after you joined - 'Balanced' matchmaking pits a team of stock riflemen against a team of heavy tanks and snipers with upgraded one-hit kill rifles - Vehicles use health bars - Lack of variety in some vehicles. e.g. each faction has only one type of attack plane, and the one available to America is the P-38 which looks and handles more like a cargo plane than a fighter. - The grindfest - If you changed your role, it costs to downgrade it back to rifleman if you found out that the role is not your thing. You won't get refunded either - If you want to own several soldiers with different roles, you have to buy new soldiers and do all the grinding for each individual soldier - Lack of World War atmosphere: There's no voice acting at all, other than the soldiers' faint grunts when they get hurt

A short and breve introduction for those new guys who wants to play this game ;-) enjoy   there're 2 types of victory in game :  1. Your team had successfully captured all your enemy team's victory point (which is a targeted alphabet marked with a star )  2. Your team had successfully exhausted all your enemy team's resources , like men , tanks , planes , vehicles , they all have a certain number at start and when it's all used , you can no longer use it .  there're 5 types of units you can choose to play in battlefield :  1. Infantry , the basic of all army , can carry all kind of weapons and purchase vehicle like jeep or motobike as a mobile depolyment base , taking AA gun or buy AA truck to shoot down the plane , using RPG destroy armor , slaugthering you enemy with SMG/LMG or anti-snipering your foe with rifle and a scope... learn how to use it , and let it bring you glory and victory .   *Although as a new player you could be killed by nearly everyone you can see .  2.Paratropper , assault squade , born in air and out from plane , can depoly to anywhere you want , but remember its an easy target and everyone can see you before you successfuly landed on the ground . usually got only one object : kill everyone you see in the victory point zone or die try it .  *Sometimes you may be killed while falling , but at least you can still redepoly to your carrier plane -----because sometimes , your team's carrier plane could be all killed by enemy pilot , then you can no longer jump and will be removed from the game.  3. Tankcrew , of course you're imaging a fortress , a fierce beast , an unstoppable tiger tank , but stop it . veterans have ten thousands ways to ruin your tank but they usually use one : take a moto or jeep to your side , throw some sticky mine or AT grenade and you can say goodbye to this world while he resupply his ammo by using the ammo crate behind his car or bike and start a journey to another poor guys in another iron coffin . pray not to meet soviet soilders on the battle field , they are all the experts on this .  *dont forget the planes , their bombs are lethal to you as well as enemy Tank Destoryers .  4.Recon squade , light infantry , head hunter , the best and easiest to earn money ,only one thing , dont try to push the line with your armor car , you may think its something swift and cool even with pretty good firepower but hell no , everytime i see it in my canno scope I can take it in one round of shot . so unless you like trekking and flanking and can always appear from enemy's behind , then better drive it away from people and ambushing enemy within the cover of forest .  5.Pilot and its plane are the worst part of this game . I think you guys released a little prematurely. There are plenty of bugs and glitches that need to be addressed.  1) Kubelwagons are made of glass, and handle like a bull on meth. Go over a small hill, and you wipe out 180 degrees. Bump into a wall, or another vehicle at .5 miles an hour and it explodes. Get stuck on a rock, under another vehicle or in a ditch, and you have to F11 suicide to leave the vehicle.  2) Recon Class. Laying prone to have a steady weapon is twitchy. Half the time you end up with Parkinsons, and a cannot even site your weapon.   3) Balance. This game heavily favors US and USSR teams. While having these 2 sides face off and battle each other, keeps the game from being a 2 way domination, balance is severely lacking. The German Heer, does not have a steady semi or automatic weapon. Both the M1M2 and the AVS are vastly superior in performance to anything the German team has. The German fighters lack the mobility of both US and USSR planes, leaving the german side with a SEVERE handicap in air power.  You guys may have released your game, but it needs a lot of work to be up to par. I have waited months for balance to be brought to the game, and honestly was shocked when the release date was announced. I hoped there was to be one last update, but once again was let down. I feel you still have huge potential, but these factors are making it hard for this long time player to continue to feel good about the game.

Written 11/6/16  So heres my basic thoughts about the game. I will address the most obvious pros and cons that I experienced about the game.  PROS :  - ww2 - upgradable weapon system - plethera of weapons and vehicles - good map design  This is a game that most peopler who like ww2 should try out. I have personally had good time running through a village with my M1 Garand, shooting krauts. I have also had bad times though.  CONs : -still pay 2 win, although its much less than it used to be. -paratroopers can drop themselves anywhere on the map, with any weapon. -poor graphics -poor physics engine -sounds are wonky -♥♥♥♥♥♥ ranking, xp and money system  Its still a pay to win. Even though the devs sort of fixed the ranking system, it still sucks, it still takes you forever to get enough credits with out paying for them to actually improve things. For example, a skin for your M1 that makes a darker shade of brown costs 79k. Imagine what an actual trigger or barrel or god forbid, even a sight mod would cost. Now consider that your default salary as a soldier starts at 8k per hour. PER HOUR. Yes, you heard it. You earn cash based on how long you play the game, not how well you do in it. No matter how many points you cap or people you take out or games you win, you literally need to play for hours and hours and hours on end to even see a visible improvement. Now, about the whole wonky sounds and graphics. The graphics are bad. They are, and there is no excuse. War Thunder, another free to play game, has beautiful graphics, so H&G cant hide behind that. Now, lets put this into perspective. There is a sniper in the hills hiding in foliage. He can see you through his scope perfectly fine. You can't even see his gunfire because even on max graphics the games render distance is horrible. Unsuitable for the large, strategic maps thats you find in assault and war gamemodes. The sounds are even annoying. Planes dropping bombs are some of the most annoying sounds, and the gunfire sounds are poorly done. Literally firing .22s in person sounds cooler than the rinky dink sound the M1 makes. Its really just a poorly done game. It has great potential, but would honestly need a different ownership and a complete revamp to make what I would consider a 'good' game

800+ hours, I think it's time for a real review.  I've had alot of fun on this game over the years. Joining a match and messing around on the over-sized maps. Coming up behind people and trolling them. Trolling teamates, teamkilling, and topping the leaderboard. Its a very classic simple FPS game. Aim down sights, shoot the gun, get a kill. But, some people have alot higher standards for video games. Many people complain about pay to win, that the game is a grind. Yeah, it is. But it's not as bad as everyone makes it to be. If you are good at FPS, you will not have any trouble getting new gear.  You can have alot of fun on this game, but many people have trouble getting past the decent graphics. This game doesn't have the greatest graphics out there. The same creepy guy for all 3 factions. The maps are very bland and colorless, and the trees look like paper. This game used to be the only WW2 game out there. Many people like to play this game because there is no future theme as many recent year FPS games have had. But, with the release of Battlefield 1, this game really is going to have to step up its graphics, as Battlefield 1 may have the best FPS graphics we've ever seen.  This game is still fun for me to play, but do I recommend it to someone who doesn't have much FPS experience, no.

**This review is also a guide on making credits in the game. Some fruity mod kept deleting my brilliant and honest guide.**  This game is fun and addictive, its a mess of bugs and issues and unbalancement though. I dont know what the grind complaints are on about, I have 7x hours on steam but ingame its more like 43. I'll say 20 of those hours were played without veteran status the rest has been vet. If In 43 hours of game time I was able to get a 2 shot kill semi auto rifle, a 1 shot kill bolt action, an OP automatic (AVS) much anti tank equipment, and unlocked 3/4s of the tanks and own some 4 of them, I cant complain about this 'grind' people speak of as I havent encountered it. Sidenote, 42.1 hours are as soviet...its torture to lose every match.  How2MakeDemCredets  Step 1: Accept the fact that you won't have nice things til VERY late in the game even with Vet status. (Except 2shot semi rifle, that shiz don't take that long and its a MUST for this 'guide')  Step 2: Aquire Infantry Assphault 12 so you unlock your factions automatic 'assphault ryfle' (AVS-36, StG 44, idk what 'Murica gets sorry never even looked).  Step 1.5: Hopefully you saved ALL your credits on your way to step 2.  Step 8: Purchase said assphault ryfle, and get the necessary mods to make it 'OP'  Step 22: By now you should be around rank 10-11 (hopefully) so just play the objective and have fun spraying down enemies when they show up netting some 9-13k per good assphault match IF you win and 4-8k per skirmish IF you win and its like 10min+.  Step 69: You could theoretically use the SMG's instead all you really need is something automatic with a high ROF, but my AVS-36 repair cost is some 8K at full red borken 6 matches later, and my PPD is like 30K 3 matches later.  Step 420: If you suck at the game in general please don't expect the above to work some sort of magic, though...honestly automatic weapons=instant +80% increase in kills.  By following these easy steps+my vet stat I got enough credits to buy the PTSD(PTRD) which is 284,000 shiny credits If I recall correctly in only 3ish probly 4 days of roughly 4-6 hour play time per day. I started at 2,258 credits cus I was a recon before I tried to save my money (dem repair costs doh). Sidenote: I know this might seem 'sarcastic' but its how I honestly do it and im pulling in more than decent credits now.  Cheers.

So this game has some good potential, with constant development, but it is sooo much pay to win. It used to not be too bad, noobs had 3-4 maps to play, and it didn't take too long to unlock stuff. Now, noobs are stuck with one small map that sucks. You start out with literally one, single-shot weapon, no other items. period. You have to unlock things, such as attachments, camos, vehicles, weapons, by taking lots of time to do the required activity to unlock it. Then you have to pay for it after you have spent hours of in battle time to unlock it. and nothing is cheap. I unlocked my first item, a barrel for my m1 garand, and I barely have enough money to buy it. This unlocking format really kills the buzz. Note, I have played this game since it was first released on steam. Now, I could barely play (3-6 fps) it since I had a laptop then that had about the specs of my toaster. Later, I got a decent gaming laptop that was a couple years old, and I could play the game well, although, I had to restart my account, even I had played enough that it shouldn't have been deleted. I was soo close to getting to go into the 'big leagues', in other words, the big maps, with more experienced players. I had a jeep and everything, then they raised the rank requirements to get moved up. Later, in the next big update, they added in a couple vehicles and my framerate went from 60fps (with lag spikes that took me down to 40fps) to 6-15 fps. No joke. So i didn't play for a month or two, simply because you can't shoot someone when they have already seen you long enough to land almost 2 shots on you before my screen even updated that they were there. Then I was able to get a desktop with i7 and a gtx 960. I downloaded the game, which had also just had an update then, and my account was GONE. That totalled 3 times, my account had been reset, along with having the requirements for obtaining anything having gone up with the amount of points and money earned per round staying the same. So, I tried to rebuild my account since now it should be a breeze to play with steady 60fps, only its taking a while (even with a decent k/d of 9:3), I only have one weapon, no other choice, no decent melee, no grenades. Weapons that come standard in any FPS. And I am forced to only one tiny, dumb map. It is such a GRIND to unlock anything. There other games with the unlock and pay for it model (wot to name one), but it isn't that bad on those games. This game requires dedication and patience, especially a game that is grind heavy, but has appalling matchmaking times. This game is way too slow, and I can bear through grinding for stuff once, but having to grind again to simply unlock basic items of war, its too much.

Honestly this game shows a sense of not knowing what it wants to be, if it wanted to be realistic it wouldn't have a health bar and be in a vain similar to Red Orchestra. Not to mention that while it has a weight system that effects stamina, it would have been more interesting if every weapon had different weights like they had in real life and effect much more gameplay wise (example being M1 Thompsons being heavier than the M3 Grease gun). If it wanted to be arcade, well it shouldn't have things like bullet drop and long wait times; nor be based on a long slow game process while trying to have aspects of other fast paced FPS.  Initially it did seem fun, but as time went on I'd say the game had moved to a position where you must have friends to even have any enjoyment from it, thus pusing away solo players from this. Nor are you able to help your team if you had other classes but were never in the appropriate squad, regardless if you had a soldier fit for that squad. Also tank combat is pretty bare compared to other games that specialize in it (world of tanks and War thunder providing appropriate aspects to arcade and realistic respectivly)  If you have friends and have no problem spending lots of time grinding while you get shot up by players sitting around your deployment zones to kill you, go ahead. Other wise, there are other games that provide better experience for realistic and arcade respectivly (the aformentioned Red Orchestra series is a better realistic game compared to this where teamwork is much more important).

The Americans had beat Germany in WW2 due to help from every nation, rush tactics, and numbers. In this game the Americans win 1 on 1 to a German in most cases. This game is one big cancer. After it come to Steam it's full of pro-gamerz and full of noobs as in a lot of games. But despite the people words that this game is 'realistic', it really isn't. You can often see the situation in 'BALANCED' battle where opposite team have planes or/and tanks but your team haven't got any tank or plane. This game is fun and a good time passer, but getting better weapons take to long and it is basically pay to win.

5/10  Pro's: -You get to shoot and blow stuff up  -Game had a good idea, different from anything else out there. -Game mechanics are solid for the most part -Game is actually free.  -Graphics are pretty good  Cons: -No Tutuorial, Just messages all over the place when starting, HUGE learning curve. -No Anti-Cheat,  -When choosing Jobs, IE Paratrooper, tank, fighter pilot etc... system does not tell you before hand (or at least its not clear, like the small lettering on the bottom of a contract) what kind of weapons you can use. -Most maps you play you wont earn enough credits to repair the equipment you use.  -Game almost forces you to pay for weapons and veteran account. -Getting out of vehicles Needs to be fixed. Game runs good until someone rolls up and hops out of the vehicle, then they turn into Nightcrawler and start teleporting 5ft. -Credits in this game are HUGE to players that dont want to pay to win. When you get thrown into an already started map and dont expect to earn many credits, in fact you may actually LOSE credits.  -The way you rank has a lot to be desired. You could go 30-0 and get less points then someone who went 0-30. Snipers really get screwed here. I often sit in a shady place and get a lot of kills, but not much experience. Also to capture a point sometimes it's a small tiny room, so you have 10 guys all cramped in this tiny room to get their capture points only to get killed by one tank hit or gernade. It's all about capturing points. My buddy isn't the greatest at this game, but he can sit in a room so he usually gets more xp than me, even though on average I triple his kills and 1/2 his deaths. -Bazooka's, Horrible, 3 sometimes 4 hits to kill a tank while penetrating armor each hit,  If you shoot a bazooka at a person and it actually hits them, you kill them, If it hits 2 inches away from them, like the wall behindor next to them, or the ground, not even 1/2 life woonded. give me a break! but a gernade will kill? - Oh and USA allways loses in the Wars, Go figure right.  This is a free game but a shooter without an anti hack, thumbs down.   Suggestions: -dont make it take a century to hit LT and a 1000 years to make general, I wont live that long. -Fix Bazooka's Not killing infantry -Lower repair and ammo costs for your weapons or increase in game Credits earned -Fix Defending Zones, make it so if you kill someone in the radius of a zone you get defending points. As a sniper it makes me SOOO mad killing someone outside of a door, when 1 foot inside I would get defender points.
Very unbalanced game.
